edu.amc.sakai.user

Interface LdapConnectionManagerConfig

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JLDAPDirectoryProvider

    public interface LdapConnectionManagerConfig
    Bean interface for collecting LdapConnectionManager configuration.

    This interface was introduced to retain forward compatibility of <=2.3.0 config files, which configure a single JLDAPDirectoryProvider bean. As of this writing, that class now implements this interface as a mixin and makes itself available to the LdapConnectionManager as a side-effect of JLDAPDirectoryProvider.init().

    Author:
    Dan McCallum, Unicon Inc

      • getSecureSocketFactory

        com.novell.ldap.LDAPSocketFactory getSecureSocketFactory()
        Assign a LDAPSocketFactory appropriate for your environment, e.g. LDAPJSSESecureSocketFactory or LDAPJSSEStartTLSFactory. This factory will only be used if isSecureConnection() returns true

      • setSecureSocketFactory

        the - current secureSocketFactory. Should not return null.

        if true connection allocation (LdapConnectionManager.getConnection()) will include a bind attempt

      • isPooling

        boolean isPooling()
        Access the LDAP pooling configuration
        Returns:
        if true connections will be maintained in a connection pool.

      • setPooling

        void setPooling(boolean pooling)
        Configure the LDAP connection pooling configuration param pooling if true connections will be maintained in a connection pool. This automatically sets autoBind to true as well

      • getPoolMaxConns

        int getPoolMaxConns()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of physical connections in the pool

        void setPoolMaxConns(int maxConns)
        Parameters:
        maxConns - The maximum number of physical connections in the pool
